summary: The Veterans' Assuring Critical Care Expansions to Support Servicemembers Act of 2025 (Veterans’ ACCESS Act of 2025) aims to improve veterans' access to healthcare. Key provisions include codifying eligibility standards for community care, requiring notification of eligibility, incorporating veteran preferences, and addressing telehealth options. The bill also focuses on mental health treatment programs, establishing a standardized screening process, and improving residential rehabilitation treatments. Furthermore, it mandates a plan for an interactive online self-service module, modifies the Center for Innovation for Care and Payment, and requires several reports regarding care and services. The bill aims to increase healthcare access and improve the quality of care for veterans.
